comment: Very easy class, really just have 2 projects, and the online hw to get a 100. He grades easily and leniently on both projects. The hw are just regular hw on d2l. However he jokes around alot and u might not like his aggressive personality. He can be mean, if you are late to class or just dont follow directions.
Best professor. really easy and understandable. a few assignments and a project at the end and show up to class

I had professor Sarmast for ME1001L. He is a funny guy with a clear passion for engineering. He gives some good advice from time to time. He recommends a textbook but it is not required. Its a lab so attendance is mandatory. His homework is 25% and its only 3 assignments so be careful. Other than that, its an easy class that I would take again.

Took him for ME1001L, has a good sense of humor, and lectures can get boring, very lenient and laid back. You can tell he has a passion, but he leaves everything to the TA (hw and projects) who grades last minute. For me, the TA never responded so it depends. A little hard to understand him sometimes due to his accent.

Dynamics is a hard course despite that Sarmast tries his best to help his students pass. When it comes to lectures he doesn't cover much. He just gives a brief explanation of the topic and gives you the needed equations. The rest of the lectures are usually spent practicing problems. Complete as many practice problems as possible and you can pass.
This class is hard and he made every effort to help us succeed. Great guy. would recommend to others.
"who cannot do this?". Truly inspiration quote from professor. If it wasn't for him motivating us each class, I wouldn't have of survived.
Best professor

He gave no feedback on homework, and you're pretty much going to have to teach yourself the material. I can count on one hand how many times he's actually shown us how to do something. The class is worth taking if you don't care about learning anything because pretty much everything is a participation grade except test but he curves those

Attendance is mandatory, but you cannot learn by attending. He does not put any grade on d2l probably until end of semester. Homework is mandatory but he never gives feedback on them and never returns them. So, it would be too late to withdraw the course before knowing that you may not be able to pass. Do not take him if you have another option.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This professor was terrible at covering the material. He is a great guy but is subpar as a professor and I would not recommend him for this course if you want to learn the material. Lectures are long and mandatory but feel pointless. Good Luck if you have to take him for this course!

His lectures are quick and he isn't the best teacher, but he lets you make front and back cheat sheets with anything on them and the tests have a fair difficulty. he rounds every test and you have the potential to get 15 points added to your final grade. Not the best teacher I've had but he is a likable guy and he is willing to help(kinda).

Not the greatest teacher or lecturer in the world, but he will help you out with a grade if you are struggling. I bombed the first exam and he allowed my next exam grade to replace the first. He's a nice guy and wants everyone in his class to succeed. My only gripe with him is that he should not weigh tests so heavily 90% of the grade is absurd.

Dr. Mehdi was one of the best professors I had, he is an easy grader, he will help you out throughout the semester and work with you for extra credit to jump your grade. One should do the homework problems he assigns & an A grade is guaranteed. I definitely recommend this professor to anyone!

DO NOT TAKE HIS PRODUCT REALIZATION CLASS. Very unorganized. We were not sure what he was expecting from us at any point. Only the person who turns in the group assignments gets a grade. This is a class about presenting case studies and has nothing to do with actual product realization.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: He works through only 4-5 problems for the class period. He had student work out the problem then he would critique. This way of learning was far better than endless powerpoints. However his lectures were not recorded so take notes. He is willing to work with the class on scheduling. He teaches how to think like an engineer, not to just pass class.

I did not learn Dynamics through Dr. Sarmast, but through the textbook and YouTube. To succeed in this class, you HAVE to spend hours of just working through problems. He does give bonus points if you solve problems on the board and curves exams sometimes. 90% of your grade is based on 3 exams. Work hard, and he'll help you out with your grade.

Professor Sarmast made a MATLAB coding class enjoyable. If that's not enough by itself, he is very helpful to his students, he always has engaging lectures, and my class received an extra credit opportunity at the end of the semester which basically gives everyone an A. The one thing he is big on is attendance, but his class is genuinely worth it.

One of the best Professor. I've so far. He definitely knows the material. I took him for dynamic and decide to take product realization. He gives us a lot of his personal life experiences in class. GO TO CLASS. he gives grades for being in class. if you miss sometimes ask for it. but he isn't best at organized the class. he is more like in person.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: With Sarmast, if you put in the effort, you are guaranteed to pass the class. He offers a lot of opportunities for students to succeed. Tests are difficult, but he offers a free 5 points to your total grade just for attending every class.

(2.5) He is a good person. No course schedule. Lets you know about the dates about a week prior. Lectures are not very useful if you don't understand the topic within the first 10 minutes that he briefly teaches. The rest is fully practicing on examples. Most people studied from outside sources to learn the material. Changes amount grades worth.

I enjoyed his lab. Sometimes, he would have a hard time explaining things cuz of his English, but if you asked a question, he would clear it up for you. He really cares about you and wants you to do well.
I enjoyed his lab.
He really cares about you and your success. If you want a good grade and learn something at the same time, take him.
one of the best, there is literally nothing bad you can say about him, nice, caring, patience, you name it, 2 things he needs: come to class on time and do your part

Ive had this professor for Dynamics, MATLAB, and Vibrations. Im going to take his lab next semester. I literally schedule my other classes around this guy. Dynamics and Vibrations are hard courses, but if you put in the effort, you can get an A. Do yourself a favor and sign up for his classes.
Had Dr Mehdi for Matlab. Hes helps you understand the program really well! Take him! We had just 5 lab assignments and one final project

Dr. Sarmast is one of my favorite professors at KSU! I've had him for MATLAB, Dynamics, Product Realization and Vibrations. Different classes but in general, tests can be hard but he gives extra credit. Class is out of 105 instead of 100, gives e.c. for working problems on the board. Great guy, but he might love vibrations more than his wife lol.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took him for MATLAB. He definitely knows a lot about MATLAB and inspires you to be better. He is not hard. Labs every other week and you can use the internet on them. Textbook not optional but you can use it on the labs and the labs are based off the textbook. A final paper in the end. The difficulty of the class is kinda a joke, but he is fun.

Very knowledgeable about the MATLAB program. Definitely pay attention to the examples is class; he uses them for his lab assignments. I would suggest buying/borrowing the book, because there are some things not fully covered that can end up on labs. No final, but a project.
The test are hard
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS
